attributes.action: make a public statement, at the Despatch Box, to confirm that any british taxpayer who, in future, is accused of defrauding the public purse through misclaiming tax relief or welfare benefits will not be prosecuted because they can claim the parliamentary defence of 'I was confused'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: All of the elected members who have been found out in the expenses claims debacle appear to claim 'I was confused' and no further action, as yet, has been taken against them.  If this is a defence for 646 of the population of this country then it should be a viable defence for the remainingg fifty-nine million, nine hundred and ninety-nine thousand three hundred and fifty four of the population.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
